quoteText: D) Compliance With Legal Process. We may access, preserve and disclose personal information if we are required to do so by law or we have a good faith belief that such action is necessary to (1)Â comply with the law or with legal process. (2) protect and defend our rights and property. (3) protect against misuse or unauthorized use of the NYT Services. (4) protect the personal safety or property of our users or the public (among other things, this means that if you provide false information or attempt to pose as someone else, information about you may be disclosed as part of any investigation into your actions). and (5) cooperate with public and government authorities
title: This service reserves the right to disclose your personal information without notifying you
